避.definition: to avoid; to shun; to flee; to escape; to keep away from; to leave; to hide from

避不見面.definition: to refuse to meet sb; to avoid sb

避世絕俗.definition: (idiom) to withdraw from society and live in seclusion

避免.definition: to avert; to prevent; to avoid; to refrain from

避其銳氣，擊其惰歸.pinyin: bì qí ruì qì ， jī qí duò guī
避其銳氣，擊其惰歸.definition: avoid the enemy when he is fresh and strike him when he is tired and withdraws (idiom)

避坑落井.definition: to dodge a pit only to fall into a well (idiom); out of the frying pan into the fire

避寒.definition: to escape the cold by going on a winter holiday

避實就虛.definition: (idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points

避暑.definition: to be away for the summer holidays; to spend a holiday at a summer resort; to prevent sunstroke

避暑山莊.definition: mountain resort; Qing imperial summer residence at Chengde, a world heritage site

避諱.definition: to avoid a taboo word or topic; to refrain from; to avoid

避讓.definition: to avoid; to yield (in traffic); to get out of the way

避重就輕.definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial; to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones

避開.definition: to avoid; to evade; to keep away from

避險.definition: to flee from danger; to avoid danger; to minimize risk; (finance) hedge

避難.definition: to take refuge; to seek asylum

避難所.definition: a refuge; a haven; a sanctuary

避風.definition: to take shelter from the wind; to lie low; to stay out of trouble

避風塘.definition: typhoon shelter (a cove where boats shelter from strong winds and rough seas, esp. in Hong Kong); (attributive) typhoon shelter-style, a cooking method associated with those who lived on boats in the coves, where crab, prawn or other meat is fried and flavored with spices and black beans

避風頭.definition: to lie low (until the fuss dies down)
